runs.comm: short-of-a-length ball at Tamim's body. The batsman pushes it away on the leg side
back of a length again, and Tamim gets beautifully on top of the bounce and pierces the gap at cover. Chandimal reels it in.
full, wide and creamed square on the off side, through the infield and all along the ground for Bangladesh's first four
fullish ball, pitching outside off stump. Tamim watches it go through to the keeper
driven hard into the square, but this goes straight to Dilshan. That was full and wide as well, but Tamim can't cash in
better from Malinga, yorker length on off stump. Tamim pushes it to cover
beats him with a straight one outside the off stump, first up
Shamsur shuffles forward, turns it into a fuller length ball outside off stump and slams it between mid on and midwicket, all along the ground for four. No big swing from Kulasekara
length ball, seaming slightly in at the batsman. Shamsur pushes it into the offside.
oooh, that was close. Shamsur tries to scoop that over his shoulder, but the length ball passes only inches over the stumps, as the batsman misses
attacks on the off side this time. Spots a fullish length ball on off stump and lifts it over the infield, over cover. Doesn't connect too well, but well enough for a couple. Mathews chases that down
that's a better shot. That is picked up from middle and off and heaved over the legside infield, and skips away to the deep midwicket fence. No inswing for Kule, yet.
flighted outside off, Tamim steps out and defends
gives it air again, but Tamim can't be tempted. Steps out and defends on off stump
almost a long hop, but Tamim can't connect as he wishes - but that's probably a good thing for him. Lands well short of deep midwicket and the batsmen get one
flighted again, Shamsur shuffles across the stumps and sweeps aerially, wide enough of the legside fielder to get a couple
flatter on off stump, Shamsur shuffles across again and works it to leg, but straight to the square fielder
goes across the stumps again, taking aim at that leg side. Senanayake anticipates that and fires it wide of off. Shamsur can't do much with that one.
googly to start, turning across Tamim. He can't do much with it.
this is fired wide. Tamim goes for a big shot but doesn't connect
comes down the pitch, but Mendis adjusts his lenght and fires it in. Tamim can only defend
goes back and tries to paddle sweep one that has pitched on leg, but can only get it away for a single on the legside
Shamsur has had enough of working the spinners around. He makes room on the off side and powers this over mid off. Lands just inside the rope
same shot, but this time he connects better. That goes fast and flat, over mid off, skips a couple of times before hitting the advertising boards.
shortish ball on off stump, Tamim rocks back, and slams this behind square on the off side
length ball on the legs, pushed slowly. Just gently turned into the leg side
that's cut away nicely as well, and a misfield allows that to go for four. Malinga is the man at short third man. Pretty much dives over it. Sachithra is not happy.
fired down leg side, Sanga thinks Tamim got a touch on this and is appealing voraciously. Unpire calmly calls a wide. Sanga not happy now.
pushed through quickly, and the batsman is struck on the pad. Appeal but no interest from the umpire
slower ball. Shamsur strides down the pitch and has an almighty swing, but is beaten by the lack of pace. That one passes over the stumps
yorker, dug out. Shamsur takes off, but Malinga moves quickly to field it and fires it at the stumps. The throw is way, way wide and allows an overthrow.
Tamim runs at Malinga, who fires it in short outside off stump. Tamim plays a flailing upper cut and gets a toe-end of the bat on it. It goes fine of the third man to the fence
doesn't get hold of that one either, but it's good enough to get four. Clears the front hip and swings. It goes high into the air and lands about three metres inside the fence, before dribbling over
short ball, slower one. Tamim charges again, but misses with his ungainly swipe
that's struck sweetly. Tamim makes a little room again, and he picks the slower one as well. This one is short of a length outside off and it's punched violently to the square fence

oho! That's what Mendis can do. Shamsur doesn't pick the legbreak I think. Shamsur tried to push it away on the off side, but is too early on the shot, and possibly playing the wrong line as well. He lobs a simple chance to the bowler. Much-needed breakthrough for Sri Lanka.
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
floated wide of off stump, turning away. Anamul tries to cut but is beaten
flighted on the stumps, Anamul bats it down the pitch, unsure of where it's turning
completely beaten by the leggie. That's pitched outside off stump, Anamul thought it would turn into him but it turned away

he's fed up with guessing. Anamul charges down the pitch and swings it away over the leg side. There's a man on the midwicket fence, but he ran in to try and take the catch. It fell short of him, and conceded the boundary
length outside off stump, Tamim pushes it into a gap
clean hit from Anamul. That was imperious. Skips down the pitch, turns the length ball into a half volley and lofts it over mid off powerfully for a boundary. Holds the pose as well.
fuller from Perera, this is fended away in the off side and the batsmen scamper one
short of a length outside off. Tamim cuts close to the body and gets it to deep point
length ball, wide of off stump. An easy single for Anamul, square on the off side.

top edge, and Mathews takes a very, very good one, running back from midwicket. That should inject some fizz into the fielding effort. Thisara pitches short, Tamim goes for the pull and the ball was always going away from Mathews, but he turns and hares backwards, never taking his eye off the ball. He dives and takes it at a stretch. Those are tough catches to gobble.
fullish on the stumps, driven to long on
a length ball from Kulasekara. Anamul tries to run at him and smash him through the off side, but it beats the shot and goes through to Sanga

run out chance, but Dilshan can't collect. Kulasekara slows it up and Anamul pushes it to point, and sets off, but didn't see Dilshan zooming in. He couldn't pick it up off the turf though, and Anamul is back in time
length ball on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
full on off stump. Anamul shuffles down the pitch and drives it along the ground through cover. Kusal Perera,, the offside sweeper does great work, sprinting across to put in a dive and cut that off.
no stopping that one. Anamul makes room again, and the full ball on the stumps is driven with excellent timing to the deep cover fence.
gets it into the leg side, where there's space
worked on the leg side as well
Prasanna slows it down, Shakib jumps out of his crease, but he can only get a thick inside edge that goes to short fine leg
Anamul comes out of his crease as well, and drills it wide of long off for a couple
tries to open the face and steer it past the keeper as it turns away from him. Takes too much deviation off the pitch though,, and beats the shot
length ball, slightly quicker. Bashed away to deep midwicket
slower one on the pads, turned to Malinga at short fine leg
top edge, all the way for six. This was length from Perera. Shakib was aiming this over midwicket, but he gets a thick edge and it flies fine, just over the third man boundary
slower one again, Shakib chops this square on the off sdie
leg cutter, short of a length. Anamul gets on top of the bounce and flicks it into the vacant leg side
length ball outside the off stump, heaved away along the ground to deep midwicket
slower ball, rolls his fingers over again, but the batsman picks it and turns it away onto the leg side again. It's far enough away from the square sweeper to scamper a second
length ball, outside off stump, chopped square on the off side
full ball, legbreak I think. Anamul doesn't pick it, gets a leading edge down the pitch and takes off. No run there though. Scrambles back to his crease as Mendis collects
fullish, hit to mid on
length ball, worked away into the gap at midwicket
leading edge again, but this time it's square on the off side. enough room there for one
pushed through quicker from Mendis, Shakib leans back and plays that into a gap around cover
gets all of that one. Shakib skips down the track and smashes a flighted one from Sachithra back over the bowler. Smashes into the advertising boards
leans back and makies use of the adjustment in length. Cuts it behind square and takes two as the sweeper cuts it off
fullish on the stumps, muscled away over the leg side to the sweeper
length on the leg side, turned to short fine leg
fired flat and fast on middle stump. Shakib defends
plays a huge sweep, but it takes the under edge. Gets it as far as square leg, which allows one.
full ball, slower one I think. Shakib heaves with all his might but misses
that's a smart shot. Very well executed. Shakib steps way onto the off side, and picks up a ball that pitches on off stump, lap-sweeping it past short-fine leg for four

and suddenly the Chittagong crowd is silent. Shakib plays the ugliest shot in an innings brimming with ungainly swipes. Kulasekara has bowled this more slowly, and Shakib misses, to turn around and find the leg stump bail has been disturbed.
sent wide of off stump, Nasir chops down on it, but it's straight to Dilshan at point
length ball just outside off stump, jams that to Dilshan as well
fuller on off stump, Nasir steps out and pushes it wide of cover for a single
slower one on the pads, it takes the pad and dribbles away to Malinga. The batsman go through
slower ball, back of a length. Delivered with a Dilhara Fernando-style grunt. Anamul backs away and gets it to cover
another slower one, short as well. Nasir pulls it around the corner, and it's heading for the fence until Kulasekara makes a diving save at long leg
floated on off stump, slower one again. This is driven to cover, who fields and shies at the stumps, but Malinga misfields backing up. Allows an overthrow
slower ball, length outside off stump. thumped straight to Chandimal at cover
wide ball, that's six slower ones in the over. Anamul bashes that one to the square sweeper on the off side.

Perera can't do a Shamsur. Nasir hops down the pitch and slams Mendis over long on. It's within reach of a jumping Thisara on the fence, but he palms it over the rope instead (it was going for six anyway).
flatter through the air, punched to extra cover
floated up, driven to long on
length ball on the stumps, batsman goes back and knocks it down to long in
on the stumps, carrom ball turning away. Heaved wide of midwicket
this is a little wider, and the batsman steps back and squirts it behind square on the off side
yorker on middle stump but Nasir deals with it very well. He jams down on it and squirts it in between backward square leg and fine leg - enough time for a two
slower ball, Nasir tries a big slog, but misses. Sangakkara can't clean it up efficiently and there's a bye for the taking
rolls his fingers over this one as well, and trying to run it fine, Anamul can only get an edge to this shortish ball. Falls short of the keeper, who collects cleanly this time
slower ball yorker, which Anamul has no idea about. Misses with an attempted swipe and they can only get one, after it hits the pad

is he bowling a definitive over here? Another slower one, and it's full as well. Nasir has a huge swing at it, aiming at that long-on boundary, but he can only get a top edge. The man at mid off runs around and takes a good catch.

oh! And almost another wicket. Anamul hits this straight to Dilshan at backward point and takes off, and Mithun Ali probably would have been out  before facing a ball had Dilshan's throw hit the stumps
slower ball from Kule, heaved down to long on

his first ball in T20 international cricket, and Mithun Ali unselfishly swats at that one. Sadly for him it's gone straight to Mathews at a short-ish midwicket. Sri Lanka have made huge gains, thanks to the slower ball.
full and at the stumps. Driven straight back to the bowler
floats this up outside off stump, and Reza gets an ouside edge to it. This skips away to the fine fence, past the keeper.
shortish ball this time, it's shoveled away to the midwicket area for a single
full and wide, Anamul chops down on it and gets it to the left of Dilshan, but the fielder dives full length and makes a terrific stop. Only a single.
Anamul, as the man who's been there a while, needs to do most of the work. He makes a good start here, swinging a slower, length delivery over square leg, and all the way to the fence
full ball, almost a yorker. Anamul swipes this away to long on and wants two straight away. Might have been trouble if the throw had hit
low full toss, slammed straight to the midwicket fielder. Only one there. Anamul is angry at himself for finding that man.
yorker on off stump, Reza opens the face and gets it towards third man
a yorker again, but it's a no-ball. Anamul whacks that aerially to long on
beautiful yorker on middle stump, Reza can only squirt it away to fine leg. Only a scoop might have made something of that ball.
low full toss again, and Anamul keeps strike by hitting it back towards Malinga
Anamul gets a big roar from the crowd, as he edges a full ball past the keeper for four. Lucky, but they all count
makes room and shovels this over the infield on the off side, the man from cover goes back to field it.

dot ball, and this is probably out. Reza was haring down the pitch after Anamul's outside edge dribble away to the keeper. Anamul wants to stay on strike though, and turns his partner back. Sanga lobs it to Perera at the non-striker's end who collects and underarms it at the stumps. Third umpire confirms the Reza was about six inches short.
shot! There's life in this one yet. Anamul skips down the track, opens up and slams a full Thisara ball past cover and all the way to the fence. That is a great shot.

berserk. The crowd is going insane after that one. Does it feel like an earthquake around Chittagong? Everyone is jumping up and down. Anamul opens up his stance again, and gets under this ball from Thisara, which is a poor length for this stage of the innings, you've got to say. It goes high over cover, and skips over the rope.

Oh! That's unfortunate for Bangladesh. Thigh high full toss. Could have hit it anywhwere, but he miscues it straight up in the air and Thisara Perera settles under the ball to take a catch. Is this a no-ball though? Umpires have sent it upstairs. It looks very tight, but since the on-field umpires didn't call a no-ball the third umpire couldn't definitively call it a no-ball. Could have gone either way, though.
